sections.title: Driver License Renewal (تجديد رخصة القيادة)
sections.text: To renew a driver license through Absher, the remaining validity must be less than 365 days from current date. Requirements: (1) Valid medical report from Efada system (Ministry of Health) - if missing, error 'عفواً، لا يمكن التجديد لعدم توفر التقرير الطبي' appears and user must visit authorized medical centers registered in Efada, (2) All outstanding traffic violations must be paid first, (3) Payment of government service fees through SADAD. License types: private vehicle (رخصة قيادة خصوصية) and motorcycle (رخصة دراجة نارية). Renewal durations and fees: 2 years (80 SAR), 5 years (200 SAR), 10 years (400 SAR). If more than 365 days remain on license, error 'المدة المتبقية من صلاحية رخصة القيادة أكثر من 365 يومًا' appears. Late renewals beyond 60 days after expiry incur late penalty fees (غرامة تطويف). Access: Absher > My Services > Traffic Services > Driver License Renewal.

sections.title: Driver License - User Roles and Permissions
sections.text: Four roles can renew licenses in Absher: (1) Principal User (المستفيد الأصيل) - the license owner, requires Nafath biometric verification, cannot renew if national ID or Iqama expired, (2) Delegate (المفوض) - person authorized via electronic delegation system under 'Traffic Services' category with valid active delegation period, (3) Guardian (الولي) - parent or legal guardian for minor dependents verified through National Information Center family records without needing explicit delegation, (4) System Actor (النظام الآلي) - automated notifications only, no transaction permissions. Each role has specific permissions and verification requirements documented in audit logs with initiator ID and beneficiary ID.

sections.title: Vehicle Registration Renewal - Istimara (تجديد رخصة السير - الاستمارة)
sections.text: Renewing vehicle registration (Istimara/استمارة) requires: (1) Valid periodic vehicle inspection certificate from authorized centers, (2) Active vehicle insurance policy verified through CCHI or Najm, (3) All traffic violations on vehicle or owner must be paid, (4) Payment of renewal fees which vary by vehicle type (private, motorcycle, transport truck). Cannot renew without completing vehicle inspection and having valid insurance. Access through: Absher > My Vehicles > Select Vehicle > Renew Vehicle Registration. After payment confirmation, new Istimara is issued electronically and can be printed or delivered via Saudi Post (SPL) to national address. System automatically verifies insurance and inspection status before allowing renewal.

sections.title: Traffic Violations Inquiry (الاستعلام عن المخالفات المرورية)
sections.text: Absher provides comprehensive traffic violations inquiry service accessible via ID number, vehicle plate number, or mobile number. Access: Absher > Traffic Services > Inquiries > Traffic Violations Inquiry. Enter ID number or Iqama number and verification code to view all violations with details including: violation type, date, location, fine amount, violation status (paid/unpaid). Users can view violations for themselves and family members. Violations must be paid before renewing driver license, vehicle registration, or certain passport/visa services. Payment available through SADAD system directly from Absher or through banking apps. System displays total violations amount and allows filtering by date or status. Periodic checking recommended to avoid accumulation of fines and surprises during renewal processes.

sections.title: Vehicle Insurance Validity Inquiry (الاستعلام عن صلاحية التأمين)
sections.text: Service allows inquiry about vehicle insurance validity through Absher platform. Access: Absher > Vehicle Services > Inquiries > Insurance Validity Inquiry. Required data: ID number or Iqama number, vehicle plate number (sequential and right number), verification code. System displays: insurance policy status (active/expired), insurance company name, policy start and end dates, coverage type (comprehensive/third party). Insurance verification is mandatory requirement for vehicle registration renewal and ownership transfer. System integrates with CCHI (Council of Cooperative Health Insurance) and Najm for real-time insurance status verification. Users should verify insurance validity before attempting vehicle-related transactions to avoid rejection.

sections.title: Vehicle Ownership Transfer (مبايعة المركبات إلكترونياً)
sections.text: Electronic vehicle sale through Absher requires: (1) Vehicle status check - must not be flagged as seized (محجوزة), stolen (مفقودة), security-wanted (مطلوبة أمنياً), or suspended (موقوفة), (2) Valid periodic inspection certificate from Mujaz system - error 'الفحص الدوري منتهي الصلاحية' if expired with link to book inspection appointment, (3) Buyer must purchase new insurance policy verified through CCHI or Najm before transfer completion, (4) Both seller and buyer must have clean violation records with no blocking violations. Payment mechanism: buyer transfers amount to system-managed escrow account (حساب وسيط/ضامن), not directly to seller. Upon successful ownership transfer, system automatically releases funds to seller. If transfer fails for any reason, automatic refund issued to buyer. OTP verification code sent to seller during process - seller provides code to buyer during physical vehicle handover for delivery confirmation. This protects both parties in transaction.

sections.title: Vehicle Driving Authorization - Tafweed (تفويض قيادة المركبة)
sections.text: Allows vehicle owner to authorize another person to drive vehicle. Two types: (1) Internal Authorization (تفويض داخلي) - for driving within Saudi Arabia only, requires authorized person has valid Saudi driver license, (2) External Authorization (تفويض خارجي) - for GCC countries driving, additional verification that resident authorized person does not have final exit visa (خروج نهائي), authorization duration cannot exceed exit/re-entry visa period. Maximum authorization duration is 6 months for both types. Vehicle registration (Istimara) must remain valid throughout entire authorization period. Error 'المفوض له (مقيم) لديه خروج نهائي' appears if resident has final exit visa, blocking both internal and external authorization. Common use cases: family members driving shared vehicle, private driver using sponsor's vehicle, temporary authorization for travel or business. Access: Absher > Vehicle Services > Vehicle Authorization.

sections.title: Vehicle Details and Status Inquiry (الاستعلام عن تفاصيل المركبة)
sections.text: Access detailed vehicle information through: Absher > My Vehicles > Select Vehicle > Vehicle Details. Displays: vehicle make and model, registration number, chassis number, Istimara expiry date, insurance status and expiry, outstanding violations, vehicle plate details, vehicle ownership history. Service allows checking if vehicle is seized/held (مركبات محجوزة) through: Absher > Vehicle Services > Inquiries > Seized Vehicles Inquiry. System shows seizure location, seizure date, reason for hold. Information updated in real-time from traffic department databases. Users can view complete vehicle history and current legal status before transactions like sale or renewal.

sections.title: Exit and Re-Entry Visa (تأشيرة الخروج والعودة)
sections.text: Exit/re-entry visa issuance through Absher requires ALL conditions met simultaneously: (1) Zero traffic violations - error 'يوجد مخالفات مرورية يجب سدادها' if violations exist, must be paid first, (2) Passport validity at least 90 days beyond visa period - error 'صلاحية الجواز أقل من المدة المطلوبة' if insufficient, must renew passport first, (3) Iqama validity must cover visa duration plus grace period, (4) Fingerprint biometric enrolled in system. Visa types and fees: Single trip 200 SAR for 2 months plus 100 SAR per additional month; Multiple trips 500 SAR for 3 months plus 200 SAR per additional month. Only sponsor (الكفيل) can issue visa for sponsored workers, head of family (رب الأسرة) can issue for family dependents. Regular residents cannot self-issue except through special 'Tasheerati' service (تأشيرتي) under specific conditions. System sends automated alerts 7 days before visa expiry date. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Exit/Re-entry Visa.

sections.title: Residency Iqama Renewal (تجديد الإقامة)
sections.text: Iqama renewal through Absher with profession-based fees: Domestic workers (العمالة المنزلية) 600 SAR/year, Private sector employees (القطاع الخاص) 650 SAR/year plus dependent fees from MHRSD, Dependents/Companions (المرافقين) 500 SAR/year for ages above 20 years per updated regulations. Critical mandatory requirement: Valid health insurance policy linked to CCHI (Council of Cooperative Health Insurance) system - without valid insurance, error 'لا يوجد تأمين طبي ساري في مجلس الضمان' appears and renewal completely blocked. User directed to insurance companies to purchase policy. Private sector employees additionally need valid work permit (رخصة عمل) verified through MHRSD integration. Can renew up to 6 months before Iqama expiry date. Late renewals beyond expiry incur administrative penalties and additional fees. Process: Absher > Passport Services > Iqama Renewal > Select dependent > Verify insurance > Pay fees > Confirm renewal.

sections.title: Travel Permits for Dependents (تصاريح السفر للتابعين)
sections.text: Service allows issuing travel permits for family members under 21 years through Absher. Steps: Login to guardian/head of family account > Select Family Members Services > Travel Permits for Family Members > Complete service requirements. Permit covers dependents under 21 years who have national ID or passport. Two permit types: (1) Permit issued on national ID - covers GCC countries only, (2) Permit on passport - covers international travel. Electronic travel permit does not require printing - stored digitally and verified at borders. Can inquire about permit status through: Absher > Passport Services > Inquiries > Travel Permit Status Inquiry. System allows checking permit validity period, destination scope, and remaining duration. Service available 24/7 eliminating need to visit passport offices. Permit generation is instant upon approval.

sections.title: Saudi Passport Issuance and Renewal (إصدار وتجديد جواز السفر السعودي)
sections.text: Citizens can issue or renew Saudi passports through Absher platform electronically. Requirements: (1) Valid national ID with registered photo and fingerprint, (2) All traffic violations must be paid if any exist, (3) Beneficiary must be physically present in Saudi Arabia during renewal request, (4) For family members under 21 years, head of family can renew through their account; over 21 must use own account. Renewal fees: 5 years validity 300 SAR, 10 years validity 600 SAR. Can select 10 years only if age 21 or above. Payment methods: Government payment system through Absher or at Saudi banks. Processing time: 2 business days when issued via Absher. Delivery options: (1) Pickup from passport offices, (2) Delivery via Saudi Post (SPL) to national address - mandatory for new issuance. New passport gets new number - old passport information not transferred if expired or has less than 6 months validity remaining. Cannot modify passport from Absher if already modified within last 5 years. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Passport Issuance/Renewal.

sections.title: Passport Updates for Dependents and Domestic Workers (تحديث جوازات المرافقين والعمالة)
sections.text: Service allows updating passport information for family dependents and domestic workers through sponsor/kafeel account in Absher. For dependents: Access Absher > Passport Services > Update Family Member Passport Information. For domestic workers: Note that actual passport renewal for domestic workers is NOT done through Absher - must be completed at worker's country embassy or consulate, then passport information is UPDATED in Absher system afterward. Update requirements: (1) Kafeel/sponsor or authorized delegate must update through their Absher account, (2) No security or legal issues on sponsor record, (3) Beneficiary must not be absent from work (for workers), (4) No outstanding traffic violations on sponsor's record, (5) Remaining passport validity should not be less than 12 months for update eligibility, (6) Beneficiary must be residing in Saudi Arabia. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Update Passport Information for Residents. Information that can be updated: passport number, issue date, expiry date, issuing country.

sections.title: National ID Renewal (تجديد الهوية الوطنية)
sections.text: Citizens can renew national ID electronically through Absher using latest facial recognition technology without visiting civil affairs offices. Process: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > National ID Services > National ID Renewal. System displays service welcome page with terms and conditions. Service uses AI photo validation to verify: white background, no sunglasses or colored contact lenses, face centered in frame with proper dimensions. User selects delivery method: (1) Pickup from civil affairs office, or (2) Delivery to national address via Saudi Post. Renewal typically processed within 2-3 business days. Updated ID delivered with renewed validity period (typically 5 or 10 years based on age). Service includes automatic verification of user's current photo against civil registry. Fees automatically calculated and paid through Absher payment gateway or SADAD. Can track renewal status through: Absher > Inquiries > National ID Renewal Status.

sections.title: Family Registry for Mothers (إصدار سجل الأسرة للأمهات)
sections.text: Service enables Saudi women to obtain official family registry document proving relationship with their children. Eligibility requirements strictly verified: (1) Nationality must be Saudi (SA nationality code) - error 'هذه الخدمة متاحة للمواطنات السعوديات فقط' for non-Saudis, (2) Marital status must be married (متزوجة), divorced (مطلقة), or widowed (أرملة), (3) At least one child record linked to applicant's ID in National Information Center - error 'لا توجد سجلات أبناء مرتبطة برقم الهوية' if no children found in system, (4) Valid registered national address in Wasel system for document delivery. Document serves as official legal proof of mother-child relationship for administrative, educational, legal, and healthcare purposes. Empowers mothers with documented family ties independent of father's documentation. Access: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Family Registry for Mothers. Document printed and delivered to registered national address.

sections.title: Family Registry Issuance for Newlyweds (إصدار سجل الأسرة لحديثي الزواج)
sections.text: Service allows newly married Saudi citizens to request family registry issuance electronically without visiting civil affairs offices. Access: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Family Registry Services > Family Registry Issuance. Requirements: Valid marriage contract registered in Ministry of Justice system, Both spouses have valid national IDs, National address registered for document delivery. System automatically retrieves marriage information from civil registry. Document issued and delivered to registered address via Saudi Post. Family registry serves as official proof of family structure for government transactions, children enrollment in schools, and family benefits applications. Processing time typically 3-5 business days after request approval.

sections.title: Birth Registration (تسجيل المواليد)
sections.text: Absher provides electronic birth registration service for newborns. Parents can register new birth through: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Birth Registration. Required information: Birth hospital name and date, Mother's national ID, Father's national ID, Proposed name for child. System verifies birth record with hospital databases. Upon approval, birth certificate is issued electronically and national ID number assigned to newborn. Birth certificate can be delivered to national address or picked up from civil affairs office. Service must be completed within specified period after birth (typically 30 days) to avoid late registration complications. Immediate birth registration allows parents to add newborn to family registry, apply for passport if needed, and register in health insurance and other benefit programs.

sections.title: Lost National ID Reporting (الإبلاغ عن الهوية المفقودة)
sections.text: Immediate reporting of lost or stolen national ID through Absher triggers instant security measures: (1) Digital identity certificate IMMEDIATELY revoked within seconds to prevent identity impersonation and fraud, (2) ID status changed to 'Lost/Stolen' (مفقودة) in central civil affairs database making it invalid across all government systems. Replacement process (بدل مفقود/بدل تالف): Upload new compliant photograph with AI-powered validation checking: white background requirement ('الخلفية يجب أن تكون بيضاء'), no sunglasses or colored contacts ('يجب إزالة النظارات الشمسية والعدسات الملونة'), face centered with proper dimensions ('الوجه يجب أن يكون في المنتصف بالأبعاد الصحيحة'), sufficient image quality. Payment of replacement fee, new ID issued with same number but new document serial, delivered to national address. CRITICAL: Once ID reported lost, it remains permanently invalid even if found later - replacement must be obtained. Access: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Report Lost ID.

sections.title: Absher Delegation System (تفويض خدمات أبشر)
sections.text: Users can issue electronic delegation (تفويض إلكتروني) authorizing another person to perform specific services on their behalf. Two delegation types: (1) Digital services delegation - allows delegate to access and perform Absher services online for delegator within specified service categories (Traffic, Passports, Civil Affairs, etc.), (2) Physical office delegation - authorizes delegate to visit civil affairs or passport offices to execute services in person on behalf of delegator. Delegation creation: Absher > My Services > Absher Delegation > Issue New Delegation. Specify: Delegate's ID number, Service type category, Delegation validity period (start and end dates), Specific services authorized. Delegate does NOT need to approve delegation for civil affairs office visits - delegation active immediately after issuance. Delegator can view all active delegations and cancel any delegation through same menu. System maintains audit trail of all delegate actions. Delegate accesses services through their own Absher account with indicator showing they are acting on behalf of delegator.

sections.title: Transfer of Services - Sponsorship Transfer (نقل الخدمات - نقل الكفالة)
sections.text: Complex three-party approval workflow for transferring worker sponsorship from current sponsor to new sponsor. Process requires sequential consent: (1) New Sponsor/Employer (صاحب العمل الجديد) initiates transfer request with worker's Iqama number through Qiwa platform or Absher Business, must have available worker quota in Nitaqat/Qiwa system, (2) Current Sponsor (الكفيل الحالي) receives notification via Qiwa or Absher Business, must approve or reject release of worker from current sponsorship, request may expire if no response within specified timeout period, (3) Worker (العامل) - CRITICAL STEP - must login to personal Absher Individuals account and explicitly approve transfer. Without worker consent, transfer CANNOT proceed and status remains 'العامل لم يوافق على الطلب في حسابه' (Pending Worker Action). Eligibility requirements: New employer must have zero outstanding traffic violations, Establishment must have available capacity (Nitaqat compliance), Worker's Iqama valid with no travel bans, no final exit visa, no pending legal cases. Transfer fails if any party rejects or system validations fail. Worker approval requirement protects worker rights and prevents forced transfers. Access for worker approval: Absher > Labor Services > Transfer Requests.

sections.title: Service Payment Balance Inquiry (الاستعلام عن رصيد مدفوعات الخدمات)
sections.text: Absher allows users to maintain prepaid balance for government services to facilitate faster transaction processing. Inquiry process: Absher > My Services > Inquiries > General Services > Service Payment Balance Inquiry. Displays: Current available balance, Recent transactions and deductions, Balance expiry date if applicable. Users can recharge balance through SADAD system or bank transfers. Prepaid balance can be used for: Passport and visa fees, ID and document fees, Traffic services fees, Any government service requiring payment. Benefits of maintaining balance: Instant service processing without payment delays, Bulk service requests processed faster, No need to enter payment details for each transaction. Balance is non-refundable and specific to Absher services only.

sections.title: National Address Registration - Wasel (العنوان الوطني - واصل)
sections.text: National address (العنوان الوطني) registration is mandatory requirement for most Absher services involving document delivery. Registration through Saudi Post Wasel system at: wasel.sa or through Absher integration. Address becomes active within approximately 1 hour after registration. Required for: Passport delivery, National ID delivery, Family registry delivery, Any official document delivery from government entities. Address format includes: Building number, Street name, District, City, Postal code (5 digits), Additional number (4 digits). Without registered national address, users cannot request delivery services and must select office pickup option. Address verification may be required through SMS code sent to registered mobile or site visit by postal service. Users can update address information anytime through Wasel platform. Absher automatically retrieves address from Wasel system when delivery option selected.

sections.title: Absher Platform Types and Access (أنواع منصات أبشر)
sections.text: Absher consists of three distinct platforms serving different user categories: (1) Absher Individuals (أبشر أفراد) - accessible at absher.sa - for Saudi citizens, residents, and visitors - provides personal services for passports, civil affairs, traffic, labor. Registration requires: ID/Iqama number, Mobile number, Email address, Account activation through: Bank account verification, Self-service kiosks at passport/civil affairs offices, or passport/civil affairs office staff. (2) Absher Business (أبشر أعمال) - for establishments and companies - serves business owners and employers - provides services for: Sponsorship management, Employee visas and work permits, Establishment-level traffic services, Bulk operations for multiple employees. Requires commercial registration and establishment authorization. (3) Absher Government (أبشر حكومة) - connects government entities - enables inter-agency data exchange and transaction processing - facilitates automated government service integration. All platforms available 24/7 with mobile apps for iOS and Android. Absher serves over 26 million registered users nationwide.

sections.title: Document Delivery Service - SPL (توصيل الوثائق عبر البريد السعودي)
sections.text: Saudi Post (SPL) provides official government document delivery service integrated with Absher platform. Service delivers: Passports, National IDs, Family registries, Birth certificates, Driving licenses, Vehicle registrations, Any government-issued documents. Process: User requests service through Absher, Selects delivery to national address option, Pays delivery fees (if applicable) typically 15-25 SAR depending on document type, Document prepared by issuing authority, SPL collects from authority and delivers to registered national address within 3-5 business days typically. Recipient must present original ID upon delivery. Tracking available through SPL website or Absher platform showing: Document collected from issuing office, In transit to destination city, Out for delivery, Delivered successfully. If recipient unavailable, delivery reattempted or held at nearest post office for pickup. Valid national address (Wasel) is mandatory requirement for delivery service activation.

sections.title: Exceptional Travel Permits (تصاريح السفر الاستثنائية)
sections.text: During special circumstances or restrictions, exceptional travel permits may be required for international travel from Saudi Arabia. Types vary based on travel purpose: Ministry of Health permits for medical reasons, Ministry of Foreign Affairs permits for diplomatic purposes, Ministry of Interior permits for special cases, Ministry of Human Resources permits for employment abroad, Ministry of Education permits for scholarship students, Ministry of Commerce permits for business owners and investors. Application through: Absher > Passport Services > Messages and Requests Center > New Request > Select appropriate ministry and permit type. Required documentation varies by permit type but generally includes: Travel justification, Supporting documents for travel purpose, Passport copy, Iqama copy for residents, Sponsor approval if required. Processing time ranges from 24 hours to several days based on permit type and verification requirements. Approval notification sent via Absher message center and SMS.

sections.title: Military Personnel Travel Permit Inquiry (الاستعلام عن تصريح سفر العسكريين)
sections.text: Service allows military personnel to inquire about travel permit status through Absher. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Travel Permit Status Inquiry. Enter: Military number or National ID number, Personal identification data. System displays: Permit status (approved/pending/rejected), Validity period if approved, Remaining duration, Destination countries allowed, Any restrictions or conditions. Military personnel can track permit application progress and verify approval before planning travel. Service provides accurate real-time information eliminating need to contact military departments directly. Permit details include: Issue date, Expiry date, Number of trips allowed, Geographic scope (GCC only, international, specific countries). Critical for military members to verify permit validity before departure to avoid travel complications at borders.

sections.title: Common Absher Error Codes and Messages
sections.text: ERR_LIC_VALIDITY_OVER: 'المدة المتبقية من صلاحية رخصة القيادة أكثر من 365 يومًا' - cannot renew driver license too early, shows eligible renewal start date. ERR_MED_REPORT_MISSING: 'عفواً، لا يمكن التجديد لعدم توفر التقرير الطبي' - no medical report from Efada system, directs to medical centers. ERR_MED_REPORT_EXPIRED: Medical report validity expired, requires new examination. ERR_TRAFFIC_VIOLATIONS: 'توجد مخالفات مرورية يجب سدادها أولاً' - outstanding violations must be paid, displays payment button. VEH_INSPECT_INVALID: 'الفحص الدوري منتهي الصلاحية' - expired vehicle inspection, provides link to book appointment. VEH_INSURANCE_MISSING: Missing vehicle insurance, blocks renewal and transfer. VIS_PASSPORT_LOW: 'صلاحية الجواز أقل من المدة المطلوبة' - insufficient passport validity for visa duration, requires passport renewal first. RES_INSURANCE_MISS: 'لا يوجد تأمين طبي ساري في مجلس الضمان' - no valid health insurance in CCHI, blocks Iqama renewal. AUT_EXT_VISA_ERR: 'المفوض له (مقيم) لديه خروج نهائي' - authorized person has final exit visa, blocks vehicle authorization. TRF_WORKER_PENDING: 'العامل لم يوافق على الطلب في حسابه' - worker hasn't approved sponsorship transfer in their account, status pending worker action. FAM_REG_NOT_SAUDI: 'هذه الخدمة متاحة للمواطنات السعوديات فقط' - family registry for mothers requires Saudi nationality. Each error includes specific guidance on resolution steps.

sections.title: Absher External System Integrations
sections.text: Absher integrates with multiple government and private systems for comprehensive service delivery: (1) Efada (إفادة) - Ministry of Health system for medical fitness reports verification, real-time API checks for driver license renewals, cannot cache data long-term as users may complete exam and renew within minutes, (2) SADAD (سداد) - Government payment system for all fees and violations, generates unique bill numbers, supports webhook notifications for instant payment confirmation, (3) CCHI - Council of Cooperative Health Insurance for health insurance policy verification, mandatory for Iqama renewal, real-time policy status checks, (4) Najm (نجم) - Vehicle insurance claims and policy verification for vehicle services, (5) Mujaz (موجز) - Periodic vehicle inspection certificate verification system, (6) National Information Center (مركز المعلومات الوطني) - Identity verification, family relationships for guardian services, national address (Wasel) integration, (7) MHRSD - Ministry of Human Resources for work permits, dependent fees, Nitaqat/Qiwa quota verification, (8) Ministry of Justice - Marriage contracts, divorce records, legal documents, (9) Traffic Department Database - Violations checking with dual verification at service start and final processing, vehicle ownership records, license status, (10) Saudi Post (SPL) - Document delivery coordination and tracking. All integrations use secure APIs with encryption, correlation IDs for tracking, and fallback mechanisms if external system unavailable.

sections.title: Absher Security and Authentication
sections.text: Absher implements multi-layer security architecture: (1) Nafath Integration (نفاذ) - National Single Sign-On for biometric authentication, fingerprint or facial recognition required for sensitive transactions, provides non-repudiation for critical operations like financial transactions, (2) Two-Factor Authentication - OTP sent via SMS to registered mobile for login and transaction confirmation, valid for limited time period, (3) Session Management - Automatic timeout after inactivity period, single active session per user account, force logout from other devices option, (4) Data Encryption - TLS 1.3 for all data transmission, end-to-end encryption for sensitive information, tokenization of payment card details, (5) Audit Logging - Complete transaction trail with correlation IDs, records initiator and beneficiary for all actions, timestamps and IP addresses logged, retention per NDMO (National Data Management Office) regulations, (6) Access Control - Role-based permissions enforced at API level, attribute-based restrictions for sensitive data, delegation verification for proxy actions, (7) Fraud Detection - AI-powered anomaly detection for suspicious activities, automatic blocking of unusual transaction patterns, (8) Privacy Protection - Data masking for sensitive information displays, medical details hidden except fitness status, compartmentalized data access based on service need. System complies with Saudi cybersecurity regulations and international standards.

sections.title: Absher Mobile Applications
sections.text: Absher mobile apps available for iOS (App Store) and Android (Google Play) provide full service access on smartphones and tablets. App features: (1) Biometric login using fingerprint or facial recognition, (2) Push notifications for service updates, renewal reminders, approval requests, (3) Offline mode for viewing saved documents and information, (4) Quick access shortcuts for frequently used services, (5) QR code generation for documents (licenses, permits, IDs), (6) Location-based services for finding nearest offices or service centers, (7) Integrated payment using saved methods, (8) Document scanning and upload using device camera, (9) Arabic and English language support with instant switching. App syncs automatically with web platform - changes on one platform reflected on other. Special features: Widget support for iOS showing quick status updates, Android share integration for sharing documents securely, Dark mode for comfortable viewing, Accessibility features for users with disabilities. App regularly updated with new services and security enhancements. Recommended to enable auto-update for latest security patches.

sections.title: Absher Customer Support and Help
sections.text: Absher provides multiple support channels: (1) In-app Help Center - Contextual help for each service with step-by-step guides, Video tutorials in Arabic and English, FAQ database searchable by keyword, (2) 24/7 Call Center - Unified number: 920020405 for general inquiries, Passport services: 0114771100, Traffic services: 993 from mobile or 00966114908888, (3) Social Media Support - Twitter: @Absher with quick response times, Inquiries portal for service-specific questions, (4) Email Support - General inquiries: info@absher.sa, Technical issues: support@absher.sa, (5) Live Chat - Available through website and mobile app during business hours, AI chatbot for common questions 24/7, Escalation to human agent if needed, (6) Feedback System - Built-in rating and feedback after each service completion, Suggestion submission for service improvements, Complaint tracking with reference numbers. Common issues addressable through support: Login problems, Service errors, Payment issues, Delegation questions, Document delivery tracking. Average response time: Social media 1-2 hours, Call center immediate, Email 24-48 hours. Support available in Arabic and English.

sections.title: General Requirements for All Absher Services
sections.text: Universal prerequisites that apply across most Absher services: (1) Valid Identity Document - Saudi citizens need valid national ID not expired, Residents need valid Iqama not expired, Cannot access most services with expired identity documents, (2) Registered Mobile Number - Active Saudi mobile number for OTP verification, Number registered in user's name, Receives service notifications and updates, (3) National Address (Wasel) - Required for any service involving physical document delivery, Must be registered and verified through wasel.sa, Address active within 1 hour of registration, (4) Nafath Enrollment - Biometric registration required for high-security transactions, Fingerprint or facial recognition data enrolled, Available through Nafath app integration, (5) Clean Administrative Status - No outstanding government violations or fines for relevant services, No legal restrictions or travel bans for travel services, No security holds or judicial blocks on account, (6) Accurate Personal Data - Information synchronized across government databases, Name, date of birth, family relations must match civil records, Phone and email current and accessible, (7) Payment Method - Valid SADAD access or bank account for fee payment, Sufficient balance for service fees, Credit/debit card for optional payment methods. Service availability: 24/7 digital access with planned maintenance windows announced in advance. Technical requirements: Modern web browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge), Stable internet connection, JavaScript enabled, Cookies accepted for session management. Mobile requirements: iOS 12+ or Android 8+ for mobile app.
